Authors: Debi, Takeuchi M., Aliyudin M.G., Nurhayati P.W., Yossy E.H.
Title: Development money diary application models on android
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Education Technology, Research Interest Group, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Debi, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Takeuchi, M., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aliyudin, M.G., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nurhayati, P.W., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., BINUS Online Learning, Education Technology, Research Interest Group, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Today many people have difficulty controlling their time and finances. This certainly affects self-productivity and work productivity in the office / business. With the establishment of the Money Diary application, it is expected to become a solute task and money management application. The purpose of making this application is to assist users in managing and managing their tasks and finances all at once in an application. The research method used in data collection is literature study and indirect observation. The application development method uses the system development life cycle method with the waterfall model. This model uses a systematic and sequential approach that starts at the level of requirement to the level of maintenance. This application is based on Android developed with the Java programming language. The result is a money diary application that can be used to daily actions, to remind users of the need to pay bills on time, to facilitate financial management for users, to remind users to perform certain actions that were previously planned. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Android; Mobile application; Money diary; System development life cycle
Index Keywords: Computer programming; Finance; Information management; Life cycle; Productivity; Application development; Application models; Financial managements; Literature studies; research methods; Sequential approach; System development life cycles; Work productivity; Android (operating system)
